pull.title: Formatting/gramattical fixes in fees.h
pull.body: Extremely minor fixes for spacing, periods, extra words.

events.body: ACK (although not sure we even want double-spaces...)
Well I believe it was triple-spaced :) so just being consistent.

There are a few more changes that can be made:
s/calcuate/calculate on lines 90 and 96
spaces at the ends of line 140 and 143

ACK pending the above nits

I wrote this code, so apologies on the mistakes and ACK on the changes.

But in general I'm not sure its worth the review time for minor comment fixes like this, especially in relatively new code.  I anticipate that this code will be changed somewhat significantly over the next few releases.   There is much other code that needs commenting in the first place or editing for clarity of understanding.

events.message:
Formatting/gramattical fixes

Extremely minor fixes for spacing, periods, extra words.

Spacing and spelling mistake

events.body: @hoffmabc Please add dots at the end of "We have to lump..." paragraph. And also fix your typo in the commit description (gramattical). I like one space too.

Closing this, it creates too much discussion for a simple whitespace change.

Also agree with @morcos . This code is still heavily in flux - more detailed documentation is always welcome, but it's not quite time to dot the final i's yet.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -225,19 +225,19 @@ class CBlockPolicyEstimator
     void processBlock(unsigned int nBlockHeight,
                       std::vector<CTxMemPoolEntry>& entries, bool fCurrentEstimate);
 
-    /** Process a transaction confirmed in a block*/
+    /** Process a transaction confirmed in a block */
comments.body: NACK on those. Doxygen doesn't care about such white space. IIrc we already had this discussion.
If we really want this, shouldn't clang-format take care of those?
Do you want to add a CommentPragmas to enforce the space comprehensively?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -225,19 +225,19 @@ class CBlockPolicyEstimator
     void processBlock(unsigned int nBlockHeight,
                       std::vector<CTxMemPoolEntry>& entries, bool fCurrentEstimate);
 
-    /** Process a transaction confirmed in a block*/
+    /** Process a transaction confirmed in a block */
comments.body: If we added the CommentPragmas spacing then this would be taken care of as well I believe.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -225,19 +225,19 @@ class CBlockPolicyEstimator
     void processBlock(unsigned int nBlockHeight,
                       std::vector<CTxMemPoolEntry>& entries, bool fCurrentEstimate);
 
-    /** Process a transaction confirmed in a block*/
+    /** Process a transaction confirmed in a block */
comments.body: I don't think CommentPragmas support this. They are a [regular expression that describes comments with special meaning, which should not be split into lines or otherwise changed. ](http://clang.llvm.org/doxygen/structclang_1_1format_1_1FormatStyle.html#ab66e80203947743add360933aa7a2256)

<strike>Looks like cf is missing this feature...

We'd need to set `ColumnLimit` to not-null, to support this.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -225,19 +225,19 @@ class CBlockPolicyEstimator
     void processBlock(unsigned int nBlockHeight,
                       std::vector<CTxMemPoolEntry>& entries, bool fCurrentEstimate);
 
-    /** Process a transaction confirmed in a block*/
+    /** Process a transaction confirmed in a block */
comments.body: Again, doxygen doesn't care about such white space and I don't think this diff is required.
